section.name: Documentation
section.p:
Here you will find Apache UIMA™ Manuals and Guides (Overview and Setup, Tutorials and Users' Guides, Tools, and References), the Javadocs for the public APIs of UIMA, and Getting Started Guides.
Note: The UIMA manuals/guides and Javadocs are also distributed as part of the binary distribution.

subsection.name: UIMA Manuals and Guides
subsection.p: The UIMA documentation is available in two formats (HTML and PDF). Here are the latest versions:

li.a: HTML online version - UIMA Java SDK
HTML online version - UIMA Asynchronous Scaleout

subsection.p: The UIMA Documentation for version 2.4.0 of the UIMA SDK is here:
The UIMA documentation for version 2.3.1 is available in two formats (HTML and PDF):

li.a: HTML online version - UIMA Java SDK
HTML online version - UIMA Asynchronous Scaleout

subsection.p: The documentation version for version 2.3.0-incubating is also available in two formats (HTML and PDF):

li.a: HTML online version - UIMA Java SDK
HTML online version - UIMA Asynchronous Scaleout

subsection.name: Javadoc (current version only)
subsection.p:
Apache UIMA Javadoc is supplied with the binary distribution, or can be built from the source distribution. We also make it available directly from this website.
Javadoc online - UIMA Java SDK 2.4.1
Javadoc online - UIMA Java SDK 2.4.0

subsection.name: Annotators, Web Servers, Tooling, and more
subsection.p: Many of the additional components found in the Addons and Sandbox have individual documentation files, which you can access from the Addons and Sandbox page

subsection.name: Getting Started
subsection.p: The UIMA "Getting Started" guides are intended to offer a quick overview of UIMA and how it works. They are designed to address different audiences that want to work with UIMA.

The section below lists all currently available "getting started" guides with their links. For more advanced documentation about these topics, please refer to the Apache UIMA release documentation.
Getting Started: Why UIMA
For first time UIMA users who want to know what UIMA is and how it can be used for.
Getting Started: Install UIMA And Run Examples
For first time UIMA users who want to know how UIMA is installed and how they can run the UIMA analysis examples that are provided with the release package.
Getting Started: Writing My First UIMA Annotator
For UIMA beginners that want to develop their first UIMA analysis component using eclipse.
Getting Started: Working With PEARs
For UIMA users who want to know what a UIMA PEAR package is, how to generate them and how to use them within UIMA applications.
Getting Started: UIMA Asynchronous Scaleout
For UIMA users who need to scale out their UIMA analytics to achieve higher throughput, get faster response time, and to develop applications utilizing UIMA Flow Controllers, CAS Multipliers and advanced error handling capability.
Getting Started: UIMA C++ Framework
For UIMA users who want to create UIMA compliant Analysis Engines from programs written in C++, Perl, Python or Tcl.
